intro: Zephyranthes entreriana, commonly known as the rain lily, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, which bloom in response to rainfall. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Zephyranthes entreriana is well adapted to wet environments and is often used in ornamental gardening.
